website_summaries.verdict: A super-simple and reliable egg incubator that first-time and experienced hatchers can appreciate for hatching ducks, geese, chickens, and other birds.
pros: Automatic temperature control, humidity alarm, and timer features
cons: The user manual isn’t as helpful as it could be, so we recommend doing your research before hatching birds with this model

customer_reviews.title: Humidity issue
customer_reviews.text: This a nice little incubator/hatcher, especially on sale. My one issue with it is the poor humidity control. Leaving the top askew to lower humidity didn't seem like a good idea and the temperature was unstable. To provide better control, I drilled 3/8 inch holes(3 on each side) around the edge of the top for better ventilation and control. To lower humidity, I leave the holes open. To increase humidity, I close the holes with adhesive tape. This won't receive any awards for attractiveness, but it is effective in managing the humidity issue. I incubate Chinese goose eggs and humidity control is essential. Hope this helps.
customer_reviews.author: LucienGordon

customer_reviews.title: Don't trust this
customer_reviews.text: Been trying to hatch some eggs with this incubator but after placing some other thermometer inside it, I found out that the built in thermometer lies. This resulted in most of the fertile eggs to die due to the false temperature readings that it gave. Wasted a month using this thing. I would recommend for anyone who wants to use this to have one or two extra thermometer to tell you the exact temperature so that you don't make the same mistake I did in trusting this flawed machine.
customer_reviews.author: EEEE

customer_reviews.title: I am very disappointed with it
customer_reviews.text: It has a hard time maintaining temperature. It was sounding an alarm for to cold or to hot three and four times a night with an equal amount during the day. I am very disappointed with it. The features are nice, if it could maintain temperature it would be perfect for me. I tried it twice, getting up every two hours all night to reset it. I was pretty good about checking it the first time as seven eggs out of nine hatched. The second time I must not have been as vigilant as only two eggs hatched out of nine.
customer_reviews.author: moutohn

customer_reviews.title: Hatched duck eggs
customer_reviews.text: First time at attempting to hatch eggs and I'm quite satisfied with the results. Of 5 ducks eggs I managed to get 2 ducklings. I'm working on chicken eggs now and feel confident I'll get better results. Only issue I'd have with the unit is that it states you can incubate 9-12 eggs. You'd be lucky if you can squeeze 9 chicken eggs in it. 12 would be impossible. Unless you're hatching something really small like quail eggs. Overall, I'm happy with my purchase. ***Update Incubated 6 eggs - 6 chicks hatched. This incubator is definitely a keeper
customer_reviews.author: PJMZ28

customer_reviews.title: It works well good price
customer_reviews.text: Works as described. So far no mechanical problems. The directions, however, are a nightmare. Don't bother even reading them it will make your head hurt. Go to YouTube. Several people have made an instructional video. Also I don't see how 12 average size chicken eggs could fit. I can get 9. I only use it to help broody hens that have been sitting without hatching and occasionally I'll hatch a small clutch with it. So the amount of eggs it hold works for me. Everything else about it is great and it's a good price.
customer_reviews.author: Karen C. Atteberry

customer_reviews.title: So far so good.  Quick delivery, easy set up.
customer_reviews.text: I have 9 duck eggs in there now. So far so good, as long as the temp sensor is accurate. I hope for a good hatch. Fortunately, I know how to set up an incubator, since I would never have figured it out based on the written instructions. I am available as an English language consultant by email and/or phone if you would like clear instructions.
customer_reviews.author: dvinson

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good, price gouging
customer_reviews.text: Works pretty well. I don’t love that you can’t really see the eggs inside the incubator. Would be better if the bottom was completely clear rather than opaque plastic. I think it’s important to note that in January 2020 I paid $56 and in May 2020 they’re charging almost $100. This is price gouging.
customer_reviews.author: JessicaCC

customer_reviews.title: Exceptionally loud, really top heavy, and honestly you can find much better
customer_reviews.text: I ended up sending this back. Set up was easy and it seemed to handle temp well, however it was LOUD! Now before you say well duh circulated air incubators are loud, this one was exceptionally loud. I sent this one back and bought a brinsea which is not noticeably loud as this one was. It was also really top heavy, more than expected. I suppose in a pinch I would order it again but, this was by far my least one so far and I already have 3 different incubators.
customer_reviews.author: FrableFamilyof9

customer_reviews.title: Works great. I recommend.
customer_reviews.text: I put almost no effort into hatching eggs and it worked. I used my own eggs. First batch 4 out of 7 hatched (3 weren’t fertile). 2nd batch 4 out of 8 (2 weren’t fertile and 2 didn’t hatch). The two that didn’t hatch could have been a defect with the chick since 4 did fine. I just set it to 38 the whole cycle. Used the turner and the lockdown method. I added a little water at a time the first batch. The 2nd I poured in a cup or so and added much less frequently. I did not us an external thermometer or check humidity.
customer_reviews.author: Crunchycloth

customer_reviews.title: consistent
customer_reviews.text: got two nice back to back hatches out of this the first time i tried it. this size is exactly what i needed. you have to use this in a temperature controlled environment to get the best use out of it though. lost my ac during the second hatch out because of a suicidal lizard and the temperature on this thing went much higher than it should have. i did catch it in time and even had a good hatch out. best bang for buck on the market right now short of making your own
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 100% hatch on the first try
customer_reviews.text: While the instructions are not very clear at all, and I still don't fully know how to adjust everything, I have to give this little powerhouse five stars. When we received it we cleaned and plugged it in, letting it run over night. The next day we gathered three chicken eggs, three duck eggs, and two geese eggs. We set them in the auto turner and candled at two weeks. All were developing great. We went on to have a 100% hatch. I even had to do manual turning of eggs while others where "locked down". We plan on starting another all chicken batch in the next couple of days. We could not be happier with it's performance.
customer_reviews.author: Sfmom3

customer_reviews.title: Not recommended
customer_reviews.text: We bought 2 sets of 6 silkies eggs and tried them with this incubator but different brand in 3/2020, nothing hatched. We recent just got another sets of 12 silkies eggs and bought this incubator recently because we thought maybe a new one will do better but they didn’t hatch either. We complained to the hatchery but it turned out it’s this incubator’s temperature settings are not consistent (i recently bought a thermometer/hygrometer). I can’t return the old one since it’s past the 30 days return policy but we will be returning this new one. It is easy to set up
customer_reviews.author: ANTONO

customer_reviews.title: Easy to clean and works well
customer_reviews.text: This incubator was easy to set up. I bought a separate hygrometer to measure humidity. I found the automatic egg turner to function well. The power cord does not have a tight fit and was easily dislodged. Also it did not maintain humidity well overnight. The temperature stayed within 1-2 degrees of the temperature set when compared to the additional thermometer that was placed inside. This was my first hatch and I had 10 eggs, 12 would be a tight fit but could be possible with medium eggs. It was also very easy to clean afterwards. The lower tray and inserts were soaked with warm soapy water and the upper portion was wiped down. I’ll be hatching again soon.
customer_reviews.author: A. Casey

customer_reviews.title: Set it and Forget it
customer_reviews.text: Bought this after figuring out our kids were trying to “incubate” some chicken eggs in their rooms LOL We informed them that’s what the hens do, but thought it would be neat to get an incubator. They were wanting to experience the whole cycle, checking the egg with a flashlight, and finally seeing them hatch. They split up in their venture and one has hens roosting on some, while the other is using the incubator. This was the first hatchling. Cutie!! Helpful hints- Don’t forget to check the water...that’s about it. Super simple to use!!
customer_reviews.author: AE87

customer_reviews.title: ... year of using this little incubator and it works great. Easy to maintain and clean
customer_reviews.text: I am on my second year of using this little incubator and it works great. Easy to maintain and clean. The pre-set temperature is spot on (although you do have to convert from Celsius to Fahrenheit - no big deal). I did have to purchase a separate humidity sensor, but this incubator has a spot hole in the lid for it to be attached easily. I had a pretty good hatch rate last year and am trying it again this year. I raise Bantam Cornish and they typically only have about 50% of the eggs laid be fertilized - but all of the ones that were hatched out. Hoping for the same results this year!
customer_reviews.author: Nancy M.Top Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Much Smaller ! than advertised
customer_reviews.text: This product did work and we did have eggs successfully hatch, my problem is that they claim 9 to 12 eggs fit in his incubator. I could only assume they meant average sized eggs. But that was not the case. We could only squeeze 6 medium sized eggs into this incubator. I was totally disappointed because we had ordered a dozen hatching eggs. So we had to look at for another incubator very quickly. I wish they had been more truthful.
customer_reviews.author: CHOCOLATEDOG

customer_reviews.title: I like it so far but a few things could make it better
customer_reviews.text: I'm on my second batch of incubating chicken eggs. I wish it could hold more eggs. Directions have poor grammar and pics aren't clear. I did what other reviewers suggested and bought a digital thermometer/humidity to place inside where I can watch it. A great thing would be if they made a latch that sits on top, and can move to open a small hole to pour more water in instead of needing to lift the whole lid up, letting warmth out. The directions saying to add 100mls of water is way too much humidity also...hope this next batch hatches!
customer_reviews.author: jules1976

customer_reviews.title: Good unit
customer_reviews.text: Nice little incubator. We put 8 eggs in and 7 hatched. The eighth was almost fully developed.. probably lasted until the last few days.Clearly our rooster is doing his job. I think the chicks we hatched seem stronger and more hearty than the store bought chicks we've bought in the past. And this unit did great. The manual leaves something to be desired but that is typical of imported products these days. They seemed to try to be thorough in the manual but translation suffered. Look online for better details on usage.
customer_reviews.author: DAO

customer_reviews.title: I highly recommend this unit to anyone
customer_reviews.text: I highly recommend this unit to anyone. I just hatched for the first time, 3 chickens and 4 ducks, all very healthy. The unit was very simple to use all I did was plug the unit in, it automatic did the rest except I did have to add water to the unit as needed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 3 out of 10 eggs hatched
customer_reviews.text: The description says that it fits 9 to 12 eggs. For chicken eggs, it only fits 9. We put in 10 and the 10th was smashed by the way the incubator "turns." The incubator tray doesn't turn the eggs, it simply rolls them around. So I hand turned the eggs in addition to using the tray. I had 3 out of 10 eggs hatch. This is disappointing. There is no humidity reading or way to increase or decrease it, which is a critical factor during hatching. Two eggs hatched a day early, which suggests that the incubator ran higher than it should have.
customer_reviews.author: wolfie

customer_reviews.title: Phenomenal
customer_reviews.text: I will update as we progress but the unboxing and first use has been phenomenal. Temp has held steady, easy set up, turns the eggs nicely. The only downside is the plastic smell. Would def let it run 24 hrs before placing eggs if I bought another. FIRST HATCH!! Went wonderfully although I did remove the chicks a few hours after hatching. The incubator is splendid but holds humidity like no other and I felt the babies weren't quite comfortable with the high moisture. All are well and looking lovely!
customer_reviews.author: Brooke

customer_reviews.title: Crap
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item in March I have tried three different times with nine eggs each time to hatch. But the incubator will not keep a consistent 38° I have tried everything moving it to a different room I am not having any luck and of course now it’s too late to return it and get another one but I believe the one that I have is defective and I am not happy at all. I have reached out to the person I bought it from with no response. All I want to do is return it and get another one.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon

customer_reviews.title: Good, reliable small incubator
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for my daughter. She uses her larger incubator as a "setter" and moves 10 eggs into this one each week for lock-down and hatching. It does a great job and she has very high hatch rates. It's helpful, of course, that she relies on eggs from her own hens, so she's not fretting about using eggs that have been exposed to shipping damage. But still -- it's great. We're thinking about getting another one so that she can increase production of the hybrid breeding lines she has been developing.
customer_reviews.author: honeychile

customer_reviews.title: Nine out of nine eggs hatched!!!!!!!!! 🐣
customer_reviews.text: I’ve never used an incubator before. (Our hens always took care of that) My expectations were not very high, so I carefully followed the instructions that came with this unit. The egg turning mechanism did just what it was supposed to do. The temperature was constant and would quickly recover after lifting the top to add a bit of water or check on an egg. It ran quietly and faithfully. 100% success! I couldn’t be happier!
customer_reviews.author: Leslie A.

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Simple and small, with almost no sound because it's so quiet. Only problem is that for my quail eggs I do have to still check on them periodically. The auto Turner tray will push them together and the ends will start to stick up, which you can't have if you want them to be able to hatch properly. Other than that it is great for its price and works to hatch eggs!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Hatches my various eggs
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use as a final stage hatcher. I successfully hatch ducks, chickens and quail in these. I cannot speak to the full incubation cycle or egg turner, as I only use these to hatch. I recommend this for people who have small batches of eggs or want to keep breeds separated while hatching, they work perfectly. As with any incubator or hatcher, always verify the thermostat with a calibrated thermometer to ensure accuracy of that component.
customer_reviews.author: Sessums71

customer_reviews.title: No real temp/humidity control - terrible device
customer_reviews.text: I actually hate this device. The lack of proper insulation made it way too susceptible to any environmental changes no matter how small or gradual. I could never get consistent or accurate temperature with the device. The maximum and minimum settings were completely useless. I had 24 quail eggs in this device and finally swapped them into another device. I strongly recommend you get a different incubator. At this point I’m only halfway through the incubation period so I won’t know what kind of damage has been caused until hatch time comes. 😡
customer_reviews.author: Sumariem

customer_reviews.title: Great first time incubator
customer_reviews.text: This was my first incubator and I placed 9 eggs inland got 7 chicks hatched. Make sure you buy hydrometer with it for a few bucks to watch humidity. Wish it had a hole to add water during lockdown. But someone said you can use a straw in top hole to add water. You can't just put it in that hole because of electricity in there. But yes if your first time I went on YouTube to get pointers from others about this item before purchase. Do your research.
customer_reviews.author: marielhughes

customer_reviews.title: Not 100% hands off, but pretty close.  Good for first-timers!
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Easy to set-up, easy temperature adjustment, nice auto-turning feature. Cons: Once in lockdown, the eggs come out of the little tray they were held in to be auto-turned and are placed loosely on a plastic shelf. Unfortunately this means they can (and will) roll all over if you move it at all, or once chicks start hatching. Woukd be better if it came with some kind of rubberized mat to help stabilize the eggs more.
customer_reviews.author: JennN.

customer_reviews.title: Only worked for two batches of eggs, then failed
customer_reviews.text: It worked great for the first two batches of quail eggs I had. The third batch it ran so hot I could smell the eggs cooking. Obviously nothing hatched from this batch. For the fourth batch I put in a secondary thermometer and tried to adjust the temperature down to compensate for it running too hot, but the temperature seems to be inconsistent, and I again had zero hatches from the fourth batch. I give up, I'm getting a Hovabator.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel W

customer_reviews.title: All in all pretty good
customer_reviews.text: None of my eggs hatched but I think that was due to my rooster not the incubator (none of the eggs under a broody hen hatched either). The auto-turner worked well & the temperature stayed where it was set. It is easy to clean as well. I do wish was that it had the option to change the temp reading from C to F. But the manual gives good instructions so it is easy enough to work with C. Also I wish it had a humidity gauge.
customer_reviews.author: aegab

customer_reviews.title: Works good
customer_reviews.text: Came on time and seems to be working good. However, when I go to open the lid to add more water for the humidity, it always want to slide off and shake the eggs which scares me. I wish it had hinges like a door for the lid to open and close, that way it wouldn’t slide off. Other than that it’s a good incubator.
customer_reviews.author: Lily Kotoko

customer_reviews.title: Enjoy hatching!
customer_reviews.text: Well I finally can hatched my chickens. This mini encubator is working good. The fan works it is fully automatic. It is warm on the inside which is great. The temperature control is working. I don't have to open it everyrime because its automatic turning . Very accurate make sure you are using the correct voltage to avoid messing it up. And for safety.
customer_reviews.author: Sexieanna

customer_reviews.title: so good. I have placed 5 duck eggs in
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good. I have placed 5 duck eggs in, they were abandoned in my yard by a Peking duck. The eggs were fertilized, I'm pretty sure, because witnessed the mating between the white Peking and the male black/white duck. The tray does turn the eggs all day long, slowly, steadily. You have to sit there and stare at it a long time if you want to see it move. Better to look at where it is and come back in an hour and see where it is. I will write another review after hatching. This was VERY EASY to set up and get going. Instructions were good. I think it's worth the money I paid.
customer_reviews.author: Charlene Mihaliak

customer_reviews.title: Easy set up!
customer_reviews.text: The incubator arrived quickly and in great condition. This is my first time hatching eggs, and the set up was very easy. I have 10 lavender Orpington's eggs incubating, and I will update this review accordingly. So far the humidity and temperature level have been easy to maintain.
customer_reviews.author: McCarroll90210

customer_reviews.title: Great Incubator!
customer_reviews.text: All four of my chicks hatched. I couldn't be happier with this product. I didn't calibrate anything prior to incubating. I set up the temp to 38. Added 1/4 cup of water everyother day until day 18. On day 18 I set the eggs on the bottom tray and added a bit more than 1/3 a cup of water. Locked them down and they stared chirping on day 19, hatching on day 20, and they all were out by day 21. I did wrap the bottom portion of the incubator with a small fleece blanket for the entirety of the incubation process. I hope to do at least 2 more incubations. I'm hoping this product has longevity.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Review based on 4 eggs.
customer_reviews.text: The first time I tried this I put 4 eggs in it at different points in time as the hen carrying the fertilized eggs only lays one egg a day or every two days. Anyway, I used 4 because I didnt think all the eggs would hatch. Let me tell you, ALL the eggs hatched! Even having put them in on different days they hatched right on time in exactly 21 days. I used 4 eggs and got 4 chicks! This worked out for us very well!
customer_reviews.author: MamaNbaby

customer_reviews.title: simple and accurate
customer_reviews.text: We have no experience at all hatching chicks. We followed the directions (except that we did not set it up a few hours ahead of time and so there was a slight plastic melting smell for a few hours). We hatched quails. We easily fit 16 quail eggs inside and so far 9 quail have hatched. We made mistakes and so to have about %50 hatch is a great return and I credit this easy incubator.
customer_reviews.author: KJPigo

customer_reviews.title: Pretty straightforward machine
customer_reviews.text: Pretty straightforward machine, instructions not so much. Only drawback is humidity levels fluctuate if you don't pay attention. Also number of eggs will depend on their size. Although the turner appears to not work at first glance, its just that it moves very slowly at all times.
customer_reviews.author: Lopezgio

customer_reviews.title: Excellent small incubator
customer_reviews.text: For the price you can't beat it. The only drawback is you will also need a laser thermometer to dial in the temp as the one in the adjustment screen is not real accurate. Our first batch is hatching as I write this review, 5 out of 10 baby quail have hatched so far :)
customer_reviews.author: kiote

customer_reviews.title: Great Product for The Price
customer_reviews.text: It works great! Too great actually, as I've hatched too many chicks since receiving this incubator in February. Things to note, temp settings are in Celsius, but no problem I learned the conversion.There is no humidity gauge, so I put a thermometer with humidity gauge inside with no problems. Also, I had to wrap a towel around it to maintain proper temps, but I also hatched eggs in very cold months. All in all, great product for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Bianca Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Temp and humidity are a must. Don’t rely on the thermometer on the incubator
customer_reviews.text: Well....for the price seems fine but you HAVE to buy a digital thermometer and humidifier to really monitor the true temp. Because this is thin plastic, the temp truly varies based on the room temp. My incubator dropped to 97 degrees and basically caused my 6 eggs to stop developing. I watched the temp and humidity like a hawk but still had a tough time keep it stable. I had 1 hatch out of 7. Going to try again but disappointed. You may have more success with a higher quality incubator.
customer_reviews.author: B. Walden

customer_reviews.title: Great for beginner
customer_reviews.text: Make sure you calibrate the temperature which is not hard to do I suggest a YouTube video. The instructions that come with them I really hard to understand definitely wasn't meant to be in English. So again YouTube is your best friend once you get that squared away you'll be happy with it I hatched 16 of 17 fertile quail eggs I'm really happy with that especially on my first try
customer_reviews.author: William Fischer

customer_reviews.title: Broke
customer_reviews.text: I gave one star because incubator worked only for 1 hatch, it broke on 2nd and I lost all eggs. :( Kids were really upset. We waited for chicks so badly. Also during first hatch I was monitoring humidity by additionally bought device and noticed that water needs to be added 2 times a day. So if you don’t want to be disappointed and wipe your kids tears don’t buy this incubator.
customer_reviews.author: gapka

customer_reviews.title: The Complete At Home Incubator
customer_reviews.text: The complete at home egg incubation kit. This kit comes with everything I need to start hatching my eggs. It has a pretty accurate thermostat...in Celsius only, a turbo fan, water try for humidity, and even a turn turner. My old expensive name brand incubator did not have an egg turner or a thermostat, so this is a game changer. Looking forward to getting some fertile eggs!
customer_reviews.author: Robert K.

customer_reviews.title: This actually worked, now what do I do!!!
customer_reviews.text: Um so I didn’t expect the random chick at yoga who sold me a dozen eggs and the random incubator from amazon to actually hatch eggs. I legit just threw water in the bottom, put the eggs in, and completely forgot that I did any of it. I walk downstairs and I hear peeping and one of the chicks had hatched and the rest were starting to!!!! Wtf do I do. Leave them in there? For how long? Do I take out the little rack thing? Do I put anything at the bottom for the chick that’s hopping around?
customer_reviews.author: ADHD

customer_reviews.title: Nice little incubator
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this for awhile now, from what I can tell it works just fine. If your eggs are on the large side 9 will not fit in the divider and rotate probably, I just turn mine manually every day so I can fit more. It is also hard to figure out the humidity level. Other than those couple things, it holds the temperature well and, works as it should
customer_reviews.author: Samantha B9687

customer_reviews.title: Not too bad
customer_reviews.text: I was able to successfully hatch one of eight eggs. I don’t like that you can’t see the humidity level so will have to purchase a separate probe for that. Otherwise I love how it automatically turns my eggs since that is hard to remember when you are busy. The directions are a little confusing but once you get the hang of it not too bad for the price
customer_reviews.author: Suzy

customer_reviews.title: Perfect first incubator
customer_reviews.text: Perfect incubator for a beginner. I have hatched over 30 eggs so far and the hatch rate was excellent! The only problem is that you have to lift the lid to add water and you need to put in your own humidity control
customer_reviews.author: Priscilla Borino

customer_reviews.title: Works great so far!
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good. Incubator arrived on time. Instructions are terrible but I knew that from reading other's reviews prior to ordering. I'm currently incubating 9 Gold Laced Orpington eggs, day 4, and the temperature is holding steady as set. The egg turner seems to be working well, too. I added about a half cup of water to the bottom and humidity is where I need it to be. I will post an update after the eggs are due to hatch.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Patchell

customer_reviews.title: great value
customer_reviews.text: We have owned many different types of incubators over the years, even a Sportsman cabinet and this is the easiest one to use. My husband put 6 turkeys eggs in, set the temp to the recommended, kept water in the bottom, and hatched 4 out of 6 eggs because two of the eggs were not fertilized. The poults stayed in the incubator to dry off and were great. He already has eggs ready to go back in. For this price a great addition to any home hatchery.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth A. Barr

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: This incubator is very good for it's price. Unfortunately the humidity is hard to monitor. That being said, I've have 6/7 chicken eggs successfully hatch. I did buy a hygrometer to place inside (still hard to regulate humidity). Overall, great for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff lyons

customer_reviews.title: Incubator hold temperature really good. But the company did not take their time ...
customer_reviews.text: Incubator hold temperature really good. But the company did not take their time to calibrate the incubator to the right temperature, buyer will have to buy additional thermometer/humidity device to adjust to the right temperature. Mine was set at 38.0 C, thermometer read low 90 F, I turn up the temperature to 40.0 C, thermometer read around 99 F, was 2.0 C off. Minus two star for that.
customer_reviews.author: CrispyOne

customer_reviews.title: increased hatch rate
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love. Our hatch rate has greatly increased since using this. We purchased to hatch geese eggs, this will hold approximately 6 large geese/duck eggs, and 12 or more smaller eggs with the included turner. You can use without the turner for more capacity (I fit 2 fit chicken eggs without the turner).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good product... will buy again ... prob thr bigger one
customer_reviews.text: So far it has hatched a lot of eggs. I bought this 2 or 3 years ago n realized I havent rated this product. We hatched over 70 plus chicks for the past 2 or 3 years including a few ducks, quail n Turkey eggs. You will have to read up on the temp n humidity of each species n do not mix eggs unless the temp n humidity r close. Next time I will probably buy the bigger one to be able to hatch more eggs.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worked exactly how it should.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to do my first chicken hatch. Although there is no humidity gauge everything went beyond smooth and had a successful hatch. Temperature stayed consistent and incubator worked exactly how it was supposed to. No problems at all. Just be aware that with small to average size eggs I was only able to fit 9 in the incubator. Even that was pushing it.
customer_reviews.author: Kristina M.

customer_reviews.title: Nice for a small hatch
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical, but these work simply and well! Much better than any of the styrofoam ones we tried. The only drawback is that the temp is not always accurate, but it allows for adjustment - read the instructions or look at a demo on you.tube.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Testerman

customer_reviews.title: It overheats
customer_reviews.text: Is easy to set easy to control, but it overheat everyday at midday always. I measured with two separate thermometers and the temperature is off by 3oF. Its a shame it even says its overheating(it reads two degrees up and blinks) but it does not cool down. I tried in different rooms with no luck. Keep in mind Im talking of miami weather.
customer_reviews.author: Marco M

customer_reviews.title: worth the price
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to try a different incubator since I never had luck with the Styrofoam types but didn't wanna dish out a ton of cash. Worked great, I didn't install the egg Turner tho, I looked up review s on backyard chicken they where pretty good and actually fit 20 regular sized eggs in candles at seven days took out 3 ( not fertile) on hatch day 14 hatched the next day another hatched two had blood ring . Hand turned .worth the price and wait :). This is my first review so I don't know how to add pics but all chicks are happy and healthy
customer_reviews.author: Kentucky

customer_reviews.title: Reliable
customer_reviews.text: Very handy incubator for small production. I actually mainly use mine as a hatcher since I usually have more eggs than will fit in this. I use a larger incubator, collecting eggs in stages, and about 3 days before they hatch, i put them in the Magicfly. It has kept very steady humidity and temperature for several weeks at a time.
customer_reviews.author: H. Robbins Doss

customer_reviews.title: Temperature not accurate :(
customer_reviews.text: I this incubator is inaccurate. I set it to 38 Celcius. I have killed over a dozen eggs with this incubator. I thought I put the eggs too close the 1st time but the chicks died the 2nd time too. I checked the Temperature and it was 110 degrees Fahrenheit. Not accurate at all! Unfortunately since I waited to hatch out more chicks I am now pass my return date.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Kindler!

customer_reviews.title: Temperature fluctuates too much
customer_reviews.text: Will not hold temperature. Fluctuates 1° high and low. I set four eggs first try. All four started development but lost them halfway through. Set six eggs this time. Will update if they reach full development but temperature is still fluctuating. Sometimes it’s 1° too high sometimes 1° too low. So far I would not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Onlineshopper

customer_reviews.title: Great little unit
customer_reviews.text: This is a great inexpensive little incubator. Quiet too. I removed the egg tray to add up to 12 med size eggs. I found the easiest way to maintain a constant temp was to wrap a light weight hand towel around the base, not covering the entire unit. Sorta like a scarf around your neck. There is a great video on YouTube, by a little boy with a British accent on explaining how to set up and use this incubator, b/c of the poor written directions. Highly recommend it! We had a 100% hatch.
customer_reviews.author: Angie

customer_reviews.title: Set it and forget it.
customer_reviews.text: Eggs started hatching 3 days early...all I did was keep and eye on the water - It even ran dry a few days closer to hatching and , still, no problem. I kept it on the kitchen counter - it really doesn't take up much space. Once I heard a chick, I switched out the platform and when I got home, there was my first chick just relaxing and warm in the incubator. This really only holds 9 average sized eggs, 12 would have been too many. The temp stayed solid at 38 degrees throughout. This is way better than the styrofoam incubators, I can store this easily .
customer_reviews.author: Robin migdelany

customer_reviews.title: Temperature and humidity issues/ very unstable
customer_reviews.text: I think everyone will agree the instructions are a nightmare of poorly translated Chinese into English. However, with diligence that can be overcome. The main issues are temperature and humidity fluctuations which are severe and causes a lot more work than the really good automatic egg turner eases work load. I know there are several reviews which praise the machine as stable with temperature and humidity. Assuming that is true; I must have gotten one which came off the assembly line as defective. I'm considering returning soon.
customer_reviews.author: Phyllis Rogers

customer_reviews.title: Great starter incubator or incubator for small eggs or small quantities of eggs.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up, reliable to use. Temp stays within a degree + or - of whatever it's set for, for the duration of the incubation. Turns the eggs reliably, and I've used it for everything from button quail eggs (very small) to coturnix quail (about 1/2 the size of a chicken egg) with good success.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy Sacksteder

customer_reviews.title: Use your own thermometer/hydrometer inside.
customer_reviews.text: It worked good until around day 3. I have to constantly monitor the temperature now. The "working" light not on, even after hours of same temperature. I do recommend that you put a thermometer and hydrometer inside. Putting the amount of water is says was WAY to much for my location. I like that it is easy to use as long as the thermostat on the unit works. I may exchange it for the same one. Maybe I just got a defective one. I do see progress in my eggs. I hope some hatch!
customer_reviews.author: Leslie

customer_reviews.title: Great for beginners until you need something bigger
customer_reviews.text: I've used this incubator for the years now. I can tell you it's great for beginners. I've hatched chicks, ducklings, and quail in it. I definitely recommend it. But you're going to want to purchase a separate hygrometer for it. I just completed my last hatch in it. 7 ducklings. I lost only one during the incubation period this last time. I've always had great luck with it whether I do a dry hatch or do it traditionally. I'm only giving it up because I'm starting to hatch a larger amount than this one can hold. I'm just giving it up to my parents so they can hatch turkey eggs.
customer_reviews.author: Snicks

customer_reviews.title: Let there be chickens
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use in my classroom when we start to review animal life cycles. The first time I used it I tried 5 poultry eggs and 3 hatched successfully in exactly 3 weeks! The directions were very hard to understand- strange wordings- but it’s fairly simple to figure out nonetheless. I plan on using it again so it was definitely worth the purchase!
customer_reviews.author: LGB

customer_reviews.title: Great Incubator
customer_reviews.text: For a beginner, this is a great incubator that does everything for you. All you gotta do is candle the eggs at day 10 (to check if they’re developing) and put them on the lower rack on day 18 and wait for the eggs to hatch. For my first batch, 11 of the 12 eggs hatched. The one that died did develop fully but got infected or died some how on the last days. Other than that, this is great incubator. The only con would the noise and the fact that you can’t adjust the humidity level. What I did on the last three days was to increase the water volume and it worked out great.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Hatching my quail eggs well. For a first Timer, I’m impressed how well it turned out. Just set it and forget it. Just added about 100 ml of warm water for humidity every other day and in about 16-18 days my quail eggs hatched.
customer_reviews.author: Purecheddarbaby

customer_reviews.title: Turning Mechanism Did Not Work - Temperature Inaccurate
customer_reviews.text: The turner mechanism on this incubator did not work. I understand that it is supposed to move slowly so that you won't actually see the eggs turn, but it did not move at all. I watched the turning mechanism for almost 30 minutes and it did not move at all. Also, the temperature that the thermometer registered was consistently 2 degrees lower than the actual temperature. I just hate that we didn't have an opportunity to test this before the return window closed.
customer_reviews.author: Alicia Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Compact Incubator that needs better set up directions
customer_reviews.text: It’s a compact incubator that fit 10 guinea eggs (for us) but there are no real good directions on how to set the temperature &/or humidity. You have to “wing it” which is how you potentially kill your peeps. They count on you looking up tube videos. They aren’t very good either. We figured out the temperature easily enough but never the humidity. We ended up taking the eggs out to a broody chicken hen for the last 2 weeks to get them to hatch.
customer_reviews.author: OBX Mamma

customer_reviews.title: Placed last 3 eggs from broody hen in on last day and they hatched fine (she decided motherhood was not for her
customer_reviews.text: 100% hatch rate. Worked well but had large RIR eggs and had to not use dividers. Also put in small temp/humidity reader purchased at Walmart to keep hatching conditions at peak. Placed last 3 eggs from broody hen in on last day and they hatched fine (she decided motherhood was not for her!)
customer_reviews.author: chigh84

customer_reviews.title: Only holds 8 eggs not 12...Poor instructions...
customer_reviews.text: This incubator did not hold 12 eggs. We were able to get 8 to fit without having the middle egg turners in there. The instructions are extremely poorly written. Our first hatch out of 8 eggs only 1 hatched. By looking at the eggs afterward it appears the incubator cooked them even though we did follow turn the temperature down as the instructions say to do so. I really want to return this item, but the return window was closed once we found out how it worked.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Rosen

customer_reviews.title: Simple to use
customer_reviews.text: This has been a good little incubator. Had a good batch rate and was super simple. Didn’t understand fully how to use it, so just pretty much plug and play with a bit of water, and I have baby chicks!
customer_reviews.author: Kayla

customer_reviews.title: Egg tray for automatic turning is small
customer_reviews.text: Great incubator, nice for beginners. Instructions are not clear but there are informative videos out there dealing with basic set up/ temperature settings. I did purchase a thermometer/hydrometer to double check my machines temp read out. Surprisingly, it was accurate right out of the box. My only complaint is that the tray used for the automatic turning of the eggs is small. I was incubating eggs that were on the larger side and only fit 6 comfortably. You could use the lockdown tray if you had more eggs but as mentioned in previous comments, you would have to manually turn them. All in all, I'm pleased with my purchase and would reccomend the Magicfly.
customer_reviews.author: KatCt

customer_reviews.title: Thermometer sensor is bad. COOKED EGGS
customer_reviews.text: I set this incubator up according to the instruction and put in a room with a stable temperature. Even tested it for a couple days. COOKED MY EGGS. the setting was at 38C. It was reading reading 42.2C after the first day! All 9 eggs lost. I've been spending 2 weeks trying to calibrate this incubator with eggs inside and it is not stable. Hot and cold. I am deeply saddened by my purchase. I do not feel confident about this incubator.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Burning Plastic Smell
customer_reviews.text: I finally had a chance to use this incubator, and after plugging it in for just a few minutes, there's a terrible plastic burning smell coming from it. I took it outside and ran it for three hours straight and then brought it back in. It's just as bad. I have nine eggs in there, but I'm not sure that we're going to be able to use it with this smell.
customer_reviews.author: Fried Rice

customer_reviews.title: Great Incubator
customer_reviews.text: I have nothing but great things to say about this incubator! Just keep water in the bottom for the humidity, and this is truly a set it & forget it incubator! I have had 100% hatch rate so far. The only thing I would change is for it to be bigger to hold more eggs. I will just be ordering a second one if I need more space. Excellent piece of equipment
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works well for a beginner
customer_reviews.text: First try we got 7 of 9 eggs to hatch. The directions are a little confusing as they were obviously written by someone that English is not there first language. Basically all you have to do is place the eggs in the tray and set the temperature. Then just check every few days and add water.
customer_reviews.author: Gosslady

customer_reviews.title: Great product works wonderfully and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Works great! We have now used this item twice and out of 8 eggs each time we have had 7 hatch! Very easy to use. Just rember temp is in Celsius not Fahrenheit. I did how ever have to go online the first time I used. To get a better understanding of the product. One thing is only 8 regular size eggs fit comfortably in the egg Turner.
customer_reviews.author: april locklear

customer_reviews.title: The cheap way to go
customer_reviews.text: Good egg warmer and turner but that is absolutely it. There is absolutely no way to keep humidity level, which is a critical factor. Set 9, 7 signs of life, 4 hatched. Most importantly, the rotating is so subtle that 3 embryos clearly stuck the shell and died. Hens are not subtle about turning!
customer_reviews.author: J. Walley

customer_reviews.title: one unit works great second unit something wrong!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased one for home use. Loved it ,worked great, purchased a second one. The second unit has not produced a decent hatch of eggs! The first unit still works great. The second had been used along side the first with eggs from same birds the original unit has a full normal hatch the new unit only one or to eggs hatch! Will update review if supplier replaces or stands behind product, something is not correct on second unit. .
customer_reviews.author: Liz Johnson

customer_reviews.title: I purchased this item to use in my classroom. ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item to use in my classroom. I had never hatched chicks before. I set the temperature and added 1/2 cup water every 2-3 days. 6 out of the 8 eggs hatched! 4 hatched on day 20. Two hatched early morning on day 21. The two eggs that didn't hatch, pipped but never finished hatching. I believe they didn't hatch due to my own inexperience with hatching. I removed the chicks after 18 hours and should have left them in the incubator until all had hatched.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa A Warren

customer_reviews.title: 9 out of 9 hatched
customer_reviews.text: Great incubator does all the work just keep humity right at 40-50 percent. Only tricky part is on when first chick hatches during lockdown. Had humidity at about 70 and when first chick was born it shop up to 87 which is not good for eggs. So I recommend keeping an eye letting some humidy out as it raises keep a constant eye. Everytime a chick hatches humidity raises and it's good to keep it at most 75. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Mario ramos

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product! Love it!
customer_reviews.text: This was my first time incubating and Thanks to this awesome product I have successfully hatched several chicks and just tonight hatched my first peacock! It works great and is super easy. My kids and grandkids love to watch the miracle of little chicks being hatched. The timing of each type of chick has been perfect. I’m so pleased with this product I felt it necessary to write a review and post pix. Thank you Magicfly!
customer_reviews.author: mel9825

customer_reviews.title: Good product for the price
customer_reviews.text: Excellent incubator for the price. However, As most of us know, we need to have a hygrometer and another thermometer to make sure that the temperature is consistent. I put my latest batch of eggs in four days ago. And a few more weeks I’ll give my review on how many of them actually hatched. Overall, I’d say it’s a good Product so far. Every egg hatched. And they all survived!
customer_reviews.author: Samantha

customer_reviews.title: Great little incubator!
customer_reviews.text: Great product! The instructions were sort of vague and had to youtube it to figure out how to set it up but it was pretty easy. I could fit 6 large eggs in the divider tray and they have been in there for 5 days now. I candled all 6 and they all seem to be growing will update with photos once they hatch! Great for the price and fast shipping with prime!
customer_reviews.author: Ume

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This product was exactly as it described and super easy to use. I plugged it in, added water and let it warm up, added 9 chicken eggs and left it alone. I checked daily for the water level and to make sure eggs were turning. at 18 days I took them out of the turner as the instructions said and 2 days later my first egg hatched and then 7 more followed. Not too bad for my first time. I would absolutely recommend this product and buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cheal crap
customer_reviews.text: Hatched 2 eggs with no problem. Second time i used it the incubator was giving off this awful smell for 24 hours plugged in--like the same smell when you plug in a hair straightener for the first time. This did not happen the first time. 5 days into incubation it is at 45oc so my chickens are fried. Cheal crap
customer_reviews.author: david staples

customer_reviews.title: Amazing "lil" machine
customer_reviews.text: If you're interested in hatching a few chicks at a time you can't go wrong with this lil machine. Add your eggs & water & 19 to 21 days later baby chicks... No need to make it complicated, just check your water ever couple days & your good to go. Have done 2 hatchings & was lucky enough to see the eggs hatch each time. 90% hatch rate both times. Such a amazing thing to witness!!!
customer_reviews.author: DogLady

customer_reviews.title: Effortlessly simple and great design
customer_reviews.text: I hatched 6 out of 14 duck eggs without help. You can fit about 10 call duck eggs. This unit doesn’t turn the egg 180 degree. Duck eggs like to be turned upside down at least 3 times a day. I feel it is decent enough. You’ll just have to extra diligent if you want a higher hatching rate.
customer_reviews.author: Debby

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: This cheap incubator is unable to keep the humidity at a stable rate and the eggs are laid on their side. It's hard to tell if they are properly turning. I was only able to successfully hatch 1 out of 7 eggs I put in there. Meanwhile, I have another (more expensive) foam incubator with a turner that keeps the eggs vertical and I hatched 9/10 eggs successfully. I guess you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Heidi Stream

customer_reviews.title: Hopefully this incubator will work. Unfortunately, the English ...
customer_reviews.text: Hopefully this incubator will work. Unfortunately, the English is not adequate and the instructions are hard to follow. The temperature gauge is not accurate. My husband tried 5 different thermometers and the temp was off by 5 points. That could fry an embryo. We are still going ahead at this point to see what happens. We have had one successful hatching.
customer_reviews.author: theresa s.

customer_reviews.title: Good Incubator
customer_reviews.text: Just finished incubating in this product for the first time and I had 100% of the eggs hatch--in this case, they were guinea eggs. The thermostat was off by maybe half a degree, but luckily I have an accurate thermometer and was able to just set it at a different temperature. So far a great design, and I think this particular brand performs better than the others. The instruction manual has very detailed directions about incubating, which were incredibly helpful even to an experienced hobbyist. I'm curious to see its longevity as well.
customer_reviews.author: E. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Great Bator
customer_reviews.text: It’s actually really user friendly. You just have to figure it out. The instructions are portly written in broken incorrect English. But the more you use it and familiarize yourself with it it’s fine. Push and hold the main button for 3 secs to change from humidity to temperature etc. and use +\- buttons to adjust. I’ve hatched 3 batches of chickens and had great success. Also I don’t use the turning try. I take the lid off 3x/day and turn them manually so we can get 20 chicks at a time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good price for a good product.
customer_reviews.text: This is a basic, yet easy incubator. I used it on my first hatching experience, and it worked well. The price is well worth the product. There are better incubators out there, but I didn't want to spend the money, until I had more knowledge of incubating.
customer_reviews.author: Robin L.

customer_reviews.title: this is a great little incubator
customer_reviews.text: For the price, this is a great little incubator. I incubated 8 duck eggs and had 6 fully hatched and doing well. I gave 4 instead of 5 stars because 2 weeks after incubation started, the auto-turn function seemed to quit. I hand-turned for the remaining 2 weeks. Customer service was great. They sent a new incubator, even though I couldn't have used it for the remainder of the hatch at the time.
customer_reviews.author: R. Porter

customer_reviews.title: Temp spikes
customer_reviews.text: The temperature was fine for the first two weeks. The last week it kept spiking up over 110F. We ended up with 3 chicks that stopped growing in eggs, 1 that pipped and died, one that hatched but was blind, and two others with deformities, and three that seem to be ok.
customer_reviews.author: Jaime

product_meta.title: Magicfly Digital Mini Fully Automatic Egg Incubator 9-12 Eggs Poultry Hatcher for Chickens Ducks Goose Birds
feature_bullets: Brand new and good quality unit for incubating Eggs
Simple style, made of durable healthy PP+ABS material
Digital Fully Automatic Egg Incubator - Fits 9-12 Eggs according to the egg size.(Usually, it can fits 9 chick eggs)
Automatic egg turner, (note: It is invisible to see the turner work, but it did turn and work, And you don't need to turn the eggs manually.) It can hatch chickens, ducks, fowl and geese,etc.
Automatic temperature controlling ensure the machine in an optimistic environment, Rohs, CE, C-tick Approved

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars1,221 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
